channel.title: Any alternatives to a jarred client?/ "File can not be found"
channel.description: Wondering if anyone has an alternative suggestions to a jarred client. We can jar it just fine, loads/unzips the cache and connects to the update server, but we get a message that says "File can not be found". We can't seem to find a fix to it, and i've even had a very reliable coder take a look at it and he wasn't sure how to fix it. I'm just wondering what my options are at the moment, we really need to get this server up and running. Any suggestions guys?

item.title: Any alternatives to a jarred client?/ "File can not be found"
item.dc:creator: @Beemobmo71 Beemobmo71
item.description:
@Beemobmo71 wrote:

EDIT!*

I’m a jackass. I wasn’t running the jar out of the client folder which is why it couldn’t find the files. I appreciate everyone who’s commented on this, (mostly sk8rdude) and i apologize for wasting everyone’s time haha. Thanks again guys.

Read full topic
item.source: Any alternatives to a jarred client?/ "File can not be found"

item.title: Any alternatives to a jarred client?/ "File can not be found"
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Ashi:

Correct me if I’m wrong, I read on r-s ages ago this problem happens when you run the client with javaw?

You’re wrong. This has nothing to running it in Javaw vs Java. I’d love to see where you found that, because that information seems wrong in so many ways. Right now, it’s because he doesn’t have all the files setup correctly on the website to check for updates, an alternate to fixing that would be to disable the updater.

[quote=“Beemobmo71, post:15, topic:545519”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=664404.msg4441660#msg4441660 date=1406855895]
There seems to be another error above the code you showed us in the picture. Can you show us that error?
[/quote]

http://gyazo.com/da86884b913ad2c8aa8d0bc27b8b00da
(the only reason the other stuff isn’t showing up is because I reloaded the client)

*EDIT
I looked in my main.java and stumbled upon this, a bunch of links to xlinescape.
http://gyazo.com/86f933877768ada6846292a64fd553b8

The links didn’t work so i changed them out to ones that I made (correctly making a download for the main.class, version, and client.zip) and it still says file can not be found when I run the .bat.

Also, under my client.java i found this code block…
" String s2 = “Unknown error”;
method13(k, (byte)4, “Client updated - please reload client”);
//method13(k, (byte)4, (new StringBuilder()).append("Requesting “).append(s).toString());
Object obj = null;
try
{”

The “client updated - please reload client” message shows up every time i load up the jar.[/quote]
Did you create a new version.xml like they had used for the client?
It needs to connect to the version.xml on the website to check what version it is.

Read full topic

item.title: Any alternatives to a jarred client?/ "File can not be found"
item.dc:creator: @Beemobmo71 Beemobmo71
item.description:
@Beemobmo71 wrote:

All of this seems to be revolving around “file can not be found”. I got the cachedownloader to work, and it loads up, unzips then can’t find the file. http://gyazo.com/42f737738aa4b47b025f0b4048fe3b53

Read full topic
item.source: Any alternatives to a jarred client?/ "File can not be found"

item.title: Any alternatives to a jarred client?/ "File can not be found"
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Beemobmo71, post:11, topic:545519”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=664404.msg4441521#msg4441521 date=1406799898]

You’re probably not jarring it properly or running it wrong.

Doubtful. This is a cache issue. My guess is someone (the previous owner) didn’t use signlink’s findcachedir() to point to some files (In Model, Sprites, or another class similar) so when OP renamed the cache in signlink, it’s still looking for the files in the old directory.
[/quote]

This sounds like it could be the issue honestly. I’ve updated all of the links in the client/gui.javas, but i feel like maybe there’s something i’m missing. It doesn’t exactly help that I have very basic knowledge when it comes to coding either i suppose. One thing that i couldn’t successfully add was the line of code “new CacheDownloader(this).downloadCache();” under the “starting up” line in client.java. This could be the problem. However, my compiler refuses to read it, even though it’s correct[/quote]
Like I said:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:545519”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=664404.msg4441519#msg4441519 date=1406796826]
You’re probably not jarring it properly or running it wrong.
[/quote]
Doubtful. This is a cache issue. My guess is someone (the previous owner) didn’t use signlink’s findcachedir() to point to some files (In Model, Sprites, or another class similar) so when OP renamed the cache in signlink, it’s still looking for the files in the old directory.[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: Any alternatives to a jarred client?/ "File can not be found"

item.title: Any alternatives to a jarred client?/ "File can not be found"
item.dc:creator: @Beemobmo71 Beemobmo71
item.description:
@Beemobmo71 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:545519”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=664404.msg4441519#msg4441519 date=1406796826]
You’re probably not jarring it properly or running it wrong.
[/quote]
Doubtful. This is a cache issue. My guess is someone (the previous owner) didn’t use signlink’s findcachedir() to point to some files (In Model, Sprites, or another class similar) so when OP renamed the cache in signlink, it’s still looking for the files in the old directory.[/quote]

This sounds like it could be the issue honestly. I’ve updated all of the links in the client/gui.javas, but i feel like maybe there’s something i’m missing. It doesn’t exactly help that I have very basic knowledge when it comes to coding either i suppose. One thing that i couldn’t successfully add was the line of code “new CacheDownloader(this).downloadCache();” under the “starting up” line in client.java. This could be the problem. However, my compiler refuses to read it, even though it’s correct

Read full topic
item.source: Any alternatives to a jarred client?/ "File can not be found"

item.title: Any alternatives to a jarred client?/ "File can not be found"
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

The issue is most probably what sk8erdude said earlier, that the localizing of files isn’t using ‘getcachedir’ everywhere.
Check all the files that load data if the path to the data is found via ‘getcachedir’ instead of a direct link.

Read full topic
item.source: Any alternatives to a jarred client?/ "File can not be found"

item.title: Any alternatives to a jarred client?/ "File can not be found"
item.dc:creator: @Beemobmo71 Beemobmo71
item.description:
@Beemobmo71 wrote:

I believe it’s trying to load the cache from the correct spot, but when i load the jar the cache file is auto sent to my desktop. Could that possibly be what’s wrong? My client is very picky about the location of things. I’m not quite sure how to make it load in the correct spot though.

-however, this is what happens when i redirect the cache to my cdrive
http://gyazo.com/3c756d03b1326323b89d3b9d3c93ffd3

Read full topic
item.source: Any alternatives to a jarred client?/ "File can not be found"

item.title: Any alternatives to a jarred client?/ "File can not be found"
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Beemobmo71, post:7, topic:545519”]http://gyazo.com/4bedd67d4600da6e871a7554690f41bd
http://gyazo.com/c352381be337c83c705b11471908d44d

I had posted a topic with these but noone replied. But these are the errors[/quote]
That would be because those two errors don’t tell us anything we can help you with.
All we know is it couldn’t load on starting up.
The drawLoadingText(“Starting up”, 20); is what the load error is saying.
Doesn’t really give us more than that.
Check to make sure everything is trying to load from your current cache directory and not an alternative.

Read full topic
